title: [Large-Scale] Science Learning Design Integrating Cognitive and Metacognitive Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic science concepts and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Emphasizes smartphone-based learning activities for working professionals, with training in applying strategies through real-time interaction

learning_goals: Learners can apply cognitive strategies (e.g., concept mapping, question generation) with 80% accuracy when analyzing science content.
Learners can utilize metacognitive strategies (e.g., self-questioning, error analysis) at least three times in project tasks to monitor and adjust their learning process.
Learners can reconstruct prior knowledge and integrate it at least twice into science problem-solving projects.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
